Description: Body sherd of North Ionian pottery Late Wild goat style pottery plate; pale slip; interior, from outside: black zone with frieze of dot rosettes in added red and white and added red band lined in white; stopt maeander frieze between bands; exterior: from outside, part of lotus bud frieze; wide black band; three black rays with black dots between.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 35, pl. 22, no. 3a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.717)
